member.summary: Audio Synchronization Status (binary combination is acceptable)

member.summary: sound files should be reuploaded (this means xml file is also needs to reuploaded)

member.name: P:RMuseum.Models.GanjoorAudio.Recitation.GanjoorAudioId
member.summary: Final data is actually exported to a MySQL database which this auto increment field is its key

member.name: P:RMuseum.Models.GanjoorAudio.Recitation.GanjoorPostId
member.remarks: Caution: this could become a relation with newly added table but if we do this we lose the ability to drop and create without losing narration data

member.name: P:RMuseum.Models.GanjoorAudio.Recitation.AudioOrder
member.summary: This determines where an audio is displayed between a list of sounds related to a specfic poem

member.name: P:RMuseum.Models.GanjoorAudio.Recitation.FileNameWithoutExtension
member.summary: Using this field content you would determine xml, mp3 and ogg file names

member.name: P:RMuseum.Models.GanjoorAudio.Recitation.SoundFilesFolder
member.summary: combining this with + .ext would preduce relative path of sound files on our file server the full path would become [HOMEPath] + '/i/' + this value
member.remarks: We had previously used different pathes because when a directory became overcrowded our connection time would increase unbearably due to IRAN internet problems, so it is sensible to store it per record and not as a global option value

member.name: P:RMuseum.Models.GanjoorAudio.Recitation.RemoteXMLFilePath
member.summary: This is also a legacy field
member.remarks: XML Schema is defined based on Desktop Ganjoor (https://github.com/ganjoor/ganjoor) code, for more information take a look at this code: https://github.com/ganjoor/ganjoor/blob/master/ganjoor/Audio%20Support/PoemAudioListProcessor.cs

member.name: P:RMuseum.Models.GanjoorAudio.Recitation.LocalMp3FilePath
member.summary: MP3 File local path on Windows Server (if item is not rejected probably it is not valid and it is deleted)

member.name: P:RMuseum.Models.GanjoorAudio.Recitation.LocalXmlFilePath
member.summary: XML File local path on Windows Server (if item is not rejected probably it is not valid and it is deleted)

member.summary: recitation user up vote (the records would be deleted manually if the owner user account gets deleted)

member.summary: User Id, defining it this way causes no cascade relation

member.name: P:RMuseum.Models.GanjoorAudio.ViewModels.UserRecitationProfileViewModel.FileSuffixWithoutDash

this would be appended to audio files names prefixed by a dash to make them unique and specfic to user filenames usually would look like {GanjoorPostId}-{FileSuffixWithoutDash}.{ext} for example 2200-hrm.xml
update [4/10/2021]: you can send this one empty
